message: I'm honored to be selected to the Committee on Ways and Means and continue to serve the constituents of Arizona's 6th district in the 115th Congress.
NA
"In fiscal year 2016, for the first time since 2009, the federal budget deficit increased in relation to the nation’s economic output." #CBOMondays
Obamacare has had a devastating effect on Arizona’s exchanges; leaving hundreds with no choice between plans and, in some cases, no affordable coverage at all.
Obamacare has been a disaster for many Arizonans. It’s time to resolve the problems Obamacare has caused in Arizona and across our nation.
“Six health insurance companies will exit Arizona’s marketplace in 2017, with some companies citing financial losses during the first three years of the marketplace.” –AZ Central

Once among the most robust in the nation, Arizona’s health insurance exchange has faltered because of Obamacare. In 2015, there were 11 carriers offering plans, some state-wide. By 2016, that had dropped to eight.

This year in Arizona there are now only two carriers — Blue Cross Blue Shield of Arizona, and Ambetter by Health Net. In virtually all of the state, there is only 1 insurer offering coverage. In Pima county, there are 2 carriers, although 1 is only offering Catastrophic plans.

As of mid-August, Pinal county had no carriers slated to offer plans in the exchange for 2017. In September, out of good faith, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Arizona announced that they would step in. Obamacare almost cost Pinal county citizens their healthcare coverage altogether.

Obamacare harms hard-working Americans and small-business owners.  Americans who do not receive insurance through work and make too much money to qualify for federal subsidies are facing dramatically higher premiums. The out of pocket cost for these individuals is increasing by about $1,000 or even $2,000 per year.
To read the House GOP's plan to repeal and replace Obamacare, please visit the website below. I really want to know what you think about it.
NA
NA
In 2017, average annual national premiums for Silver plan for a 40-year-old without a tax subsidy was $4,929. This is more than a $1,000 increase since 2014.
In 2016, there were 182 counties in HealthCare.gov states with only one insurer participating on the exchange. In 2017, there are 687 counties.
Arizonans need more choices in healthcare. Obamacare discouraged new innovative health products through over regulation.
Individuals should be allowed to use consumer-driven health products, such as flexibility through HSAs and other savings plans.
Arizonans should be allowed to use any credits or subsidies outside of the government run exchanges, for any products that they want and need.
I agree with the experts who say that innovative private-sector tools will enable transparent markets & foster informed decision-making.  Arizonans should be allowed real choices.

Today I reintroduced the Fair Investment Opportunities for Professional Experts Act with bipartisan support. In America today, some of the greatest investment opportunities are available only to those who meet a certain wealth threshold. Last Congress this legislation (H.R. 2187) passed through Congress with the overwhelming bipartisan support of (347 yea- 8 nay) and this Congress I look forward to advancing this legislation to help drive economic growth.

Wanted everyone to be aware of this notice from the Office of the Inspector General:   The Acting Inspector General of Social Security, Gale Stallworth Stone, is urging citizens to remain vigilant of a nationwide telephone impersonation scheme.   Since alerting the public in early March about suspicious calls from people posing as Office of the Inspector General (OIG) investigators, the Social Security Administration (SSA) and the OIG have received additional reports and information about the phone scheme from citizens across the country.  According to reports, the calls include a recorded message from an “officer with the Inspector General of Social Security.”  The recording states the person’s Social Security account, Social Security number (SSN), and/or benefits are suspended, and the person should call a non-SSA number to resolve the issue.  The Acting Inspector General advises against calling any number provided by a suspicious source, as the unknown source might pressure you to provide your personal information, or to make a payment or purchase for fictitious reasons.  https://oig.ssa.gov/newsroom/news-releases/march30-advisory

CBO projects that in 10 years Social Security and other mandatory health spending will increase 82% [$1.6T] other mandatory spending will grow 40% [$198B]. Discretionary spending will increase by 22% [$265B] and Net interest spending will raise 185% assuming low interest rates.

“Based on American Action Forum (AAF) research, the IRS currently imposes 8.1 billion hours of paperwork and generates more than 1,000 tax forms. To put these incredible burdens into perspective, that is 25 hours per person in the U.S. or 54 hours per taxpayer. In other words, the average working American spends more than a week sifting through paperwork and preparing to file”

Filling out annual IRS tax returns can be a hassle and take a long time, but the National Taxpayers Union Foundation has determined just how bad it is: in total, Americans spend 797,000 years worth of labor complying.

At approximately 5:15 pm EST/2:15 pm AZ time, I will be on the House Floor speaking about the importance of keeping America’s finances solvent. Please tune in on CSPAN shortly.

We have a math problem in this country. By FY2027, CBO projects only 11% of our budget will be designated to discretionary spending (medical research, environment, education, etc), while the rest goes to mandatory spending. In my Floor speech last night, I used demographics to highlight one of the greatest threats to our society--out of control government spending.

Thank you C-SPAN for having me on to discuss my proposal of responsible debt management once the debt ceiling is reached. The legislation I've proposed once enacted, requires the Secretary to issue GDP-linked bonds (“trills”) to pay the principal and interest on the public debt. This authorizes the President to request rescission of certain unobligated balances, estimated to be over $900billion, in addition to selling off mortgage-related assets. Individuals all over the world are starting to use cryptocurrencies for small every day transactions, yet here in the States we have fallen behind and make cryptocurrency use more of a challenge than it needs to be. With this simple legislative change, anyone can make digital payments to buy a newspaper or a bike without worrying about tax code challenges.  https://schweikert.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/creating-tax-parity-cryptocurrencies

"People who use digital currency such as bitcoin for small purchases face a big problem: Under current tax rules, any little transaction—like buying a cup of coffee—can be considered a capital gain, and trigger an obligation to the IRS."
"Opportunity is coming, and opportunity is coming for every American." fairandsimple.gop/

This tax reform is so much more than just tax cuts. This is designed to create economic growth.  https://fairandsimple.gop/

My colleagues at the Ways and Means Committee describe how important tax reform is for citizens across this country. Simplification - a fairer tax system - with rates that actually stimulate growth and job opportunities is vital for all. #TaxReformTuesday

I voted YES on Tax Cuts & Jobs Act, fulfilling the promise to bring fairer taxes to the American people.  Once signed into law, the new tax code will not just expand, but double, the Child Tax Credit, keep the adoption tax credit, and improve education savings.  This tax bill will provide for relief with expensive medical bills, help eliminate the harsh penalties of the individual mandate, and will help graduate students keep their tuition exemptions. Today is a historic day.

For those questioning why this tax bill is needed for Americans, I provided a full length explanation on the House Floor of the situation that we are in if we do not have economic growth. Even the farthest Left agree that more than 3/4th of Americans will see benefits from this bill.  https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/12/17/upshot/tax-calculator.html
